title: Option to wait on running transfer when issuing a datalad get on the same file many times
body:
#### What is the problem?
In certain situations, we may call `datalad get` on the same file many times. Currently, when requesting the file content a second time, the following error is thrown:
```bash
Total (0 ok, 1 failed out of 1):   0%| | 0.00/61.5M [00:00<?, ?B/s][WARNING] Running get resulted in stderr output: git-annex: get: 1 failed
 
                                                                      [ERROR  ] transfer already in progress, or unable to take transfer lock; Unable to access these remotes: google; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	9b7e766e-eecb-4cc9-a893-cb6329d1fe1b -- [google]; ; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: github) [get(/home/simon/Documents/carmin-server/data/admin/test82/9.txt)] 
get(error): /home/simon/Documents/carmin-server/data/admin/test82/9.txt (file) [transfer already in progress, or unable to take transfer lock; Unable to access these remotes: google; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	9b7e766e-eecb-4cc9-a893-cb6329d1fe1b -- [google]; ; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: github)]
```
Note: The error was formatted this way in my terminal.

I looked at the Datalad documentation and didn't find any option that would, when calling `datalad get` on a given file another time, wait for the first `get` operation to complete and then exit normally. Such an option would solve some of the possible issues our platform could encounter through its usage of Datalad. (Please ping @glatard if further information is needed)  
 
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Publish a large file to a remote sibling.
3. Drop the large file.
2. Perform 2 concurrent `get` operations of the large file.

#### What version of DataLad are you using?
Datalad: datalad 0.10.1
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
Remotes: Github with a dependency to Google Drive

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before?
I have been using Datalad a lot throughout the last 7 weeks and I really enjoyed my experience. It was very challenging at first due to the particular use cases I had and the technological stack that git-annex and Datalad both represent for newcomers, but very straight forward and easy to use once the workflow is understood.
